levels.level_description: This level involves basic tasks and activities that are typically performed under close supervision. Individuals at this level are learning and building foundational skills.
At this level, individuals can perform tasks with some guidance and support. They contribute to team efforts and continue to develop their skills.
Individuals at this level can work independently and apply their skills to routine tasks and activities. They have a solid understanding of the subject matter.
This level involves more complex and specialized tasks. Individuals are capable of providing guidance and support to others and can handle non-routine situations.
At this level, individuals have a deep understanding of the domain and can ensure the quality of work. They may also provide advice and guidance to others.
Individuals at this level have a strategic perspective and can initiate projects, set strategies, and manage complex endeavors. They play a leadership role.

This is the highest level in SFIA, and it involves influencing and shaping the organization's direction and vision. Individuals at this level are senior leaders who can mobilize resources and drive significant change.
